meanings.definition: The state of being older or higher in rank or status than others.
meanings.sent1: In our family, grandma's seniority makes her the wisest.
meanings.sent2: At work, seniority often determines who gets to choose vacation days first.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed seniority over the new puppy, insisting on the comfiest spot.
meanings.sent4: His seniority in the company gave him a sense of authority and respect.
meanings.sent5: The seniority of the ancient tree was evident in its towering height and thick trunk.

meanings.definition: A privileged status attained by length of continuous service.
meanings.sent1: After many years of hard work, she finally achieved seniority in her job.
meanings.sent2: In the military, seniority can lead to more responsibilities and higher pay.
meanings.sent3: The seniority of the oldest employee was celebrated with a special cake.
meanings.sent4: His dedication and commitment earned him seniority within the organization.
meanings.sent5: The seniority of the veteran firefighter was evident in his calm demeanor during emergencies.
